title: Derm-T2IM: Harnessing Synthetic Skin Lesion Data via Stable Diffusion Models for Enhanced Skin Disease Classification using ViT and CNN. (arXiv:2401.05159v1 [cs.CV])
abstract: This study explores the utilization of Dermatoscopic synthetic data generated through stable diffusion models as a strategy for enhancing the robustness of machine learning model training. Synthetic data generation plays a pivotal role in mitigating challenges associated with limited labeled datasets, thereby facilitating more effective model training. In this context, we aim to incorporate enhanced data transformation techniques by extending the recent success of few-shot learning and a small amount of data representation in text-to-image latent diffusion models. The optimally tuned model is further used for rendering high-quality skin lesion synthetic data with diverse and realistic characteristics, providing a valuable supplement and diversity to the existing training data. We investigate the impact of incorporating newly generated synthetic data into the training pipeline of state-of-art machine learning models, assessing its effectiveness in enhancing model performance and general

Title: Derm-T2IM: Harnessing Synthetic Skin Lesion Data via Stable Diffusion Models for Enhanced Skin Disease Classification using ViT and CNN. (arXiv:2401.05159v1 [cs.CV])
Abstract: This study explores the utilization of Dermatoscopic synthetic data generated through stable diffusion models as a strategy for enhancing the robustness of machine learning model training. Synthetic data generation plays a pivotal role in mitigating challenges associated with limited labeled datasets, thereby facilitating more effective model training. In this context, we aim to incorporate enhanced data transformation techniques by extending the recent success of few-shot learning and a small amount of data representation in text-to-image latent diffusion models. The optimally tuned model is further used for rendering high-quality skin lesion synthetic data with diverse and realistic characteristics, providing a valuable supplement and diversity to the existing training data. We investigate the impact of incorporating newly generated synthetic data into the training pipeline of state-of-art machine learning models, assessing its effectiveness in enhancing model performance and general
translated_title: Derm-T2IM：利用稳定扩散模型的合成皮损数据，通过ViT和CNN增强皮肤疾病分类
translated_abstract: 本研究探索了利用通过稳定扩散模型生成的皮肤镜合成数据作为增强机器学习模型训练鲁棒性的策略。合成数据生成在缓解有限标记数据集所带来的挑战方面发挥着关键作用，从而促进更有效的模型训练。在这个背景下，我们通过扩展最近在文本到图像潜在扩散模型中的少样本学习和少量数据表示的成功，目标是将增强的数据转换技术纳入其中。经过优化调整的模型进一步用于生成具有多样性和逼真特征的高质量皮损合成数据，为现有训练数据提供了有价值的补充和多样性。我们研究了将新生成的合成数据纳入最先进的机器学习模型的训练流程对模型性能和泛化能力的影响。
tldr: 本研究利用稳定扩散模型生成合成皮肤镜数据，增强机器学习模型训练的鲁棒性，并在皮肤疾病分类中探索了其有效性。
